clinical_study.brief_title: Value of Using Pioglitazone in Chronic Myeloid Leukemia Treatment
clinical_study.official_title: Potential Utility of Peroxisome Proliferator-activated Receptor Gamma Agonists in the Eradication of Chronic Myeloid Leukemia Stem Cells: Myth or Truth?

brief_summary.textblock: Assessment of patients response and expression levels of CITED2 and HIF2a genes on adding pioglitazone to imatinib therapy.

detailed_description.textblock: Eligible denovo CML patients will be treated by combination drug therapy of imatinib 400 mg plus pioglitazone (15 - 30mg).They will be on follow up for their complete blood count (CBC), chemistry profile and random blood sugar every 2 weeks. After 3, 6 and 12 months of treatment the patients response will be evaluated and compared with the obtained responses of a historical control group. Assessment of the hypoxia induced factor 2 alpha (HIF2a) gene and CBP/p300-interacting transactivator with glutamic acid (E) and aspartic acid (D)-rich tail 2 (CITED2) gene expression levels before and after 6 months of treatment will be additionally evaluated.

primary_outcome.measure: Rate of major molecular response(MMR) at 12 months
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of patients obtaining MMR at 12 months

primary_outcome.measure: Impact of treatment on the expression levels of stemness genes
primary_outcome.description: Follow up the expression of CITED2 and HIF2a genes pattern

secondary_outcome.measure: Impact of treatment on the rate of transformation
secondary_outcome.description: Progression into accelerated or blastic phases

arm_group.description: Patients treated with both drugs ( imatinib and pioglitazone)

intervention.description: pioglitazone (7.5-30 mg) once daily plus imatinib 400 mg 6 months

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- CML cases (BCR-ABL1 positive)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Accelerated or blastic crisis
- Atypical CML (BCR-ABL1 negative)
- Chronic myelomonocytic leukemia (CMML)
- Pregnant or breastfeeding females.
- Patients with severe organ dysfunction

responsible_party.investigator_title: Assistant lecturer of Hematology (Internal medicine department)
